docs.lead_paragraph: ABOUT four years there arrived one dark ago evening at the New York Zoological Park a mother and her baby; the mother a full-grown, wild, savage creature, fierce and bitter, ready to dare death itself in defense of her little one, whom she clasped to her desperately, infolding it in her long, hairy arms, and keeping a sharp lookout all the time for any signs of danger.

headline.main: Animals with a History: Dohong, the Orang-Utan; An Orphan at an Early Age, He Owes His Life to the Tender Ministrations of His Keepers at the Zoo---Flirtations with Polly the Chimpanzee---His Craftiness.
